job.name: SSH_Remote_Script_Execution

variable.name: SSH_HOST
variable.description: Hostname or IP address of the remote host machine

variable.name: SSH_PORT
variable.description: The listening port of the SSH server. Default value is 22

variable.name: AUTHENTICATION_METHOD
variable.description: Authentication method to use either password or private key

variable.name: AUTHENTICATION_METHOD_HANDLER
variable.description: Handler which enables SSH_PASSWORD field or SSH_PRIVATE_KEY based on the chosen AUTHENTICATION_METHOD

variable.name: SSH_COMMAND
variable.description: The command to be executed on the remote machine

job.description: A workflow example that executes a script on a remote machine using SSH protocol. The script is provided as the task pre-script and stored in a file where the name is given by the PRE_SCRIPT_AS_FILE Generic Information. Besides, the user can provide another SSH command via the SSH_COMMAND variable. This command will be appended at the end of the script.

script.code: echo "Script: $0" echo "Running on $(hostname)" echo "Date on the current system: `date`"

metadata.visualization: remote_script_execution_with_ssh
